src.gui.PlotAPDCounts3 module¶

class src.gui.PlotAPDCounts3.PlotAPD(canvas=None, sampleRate=1000.0, bufferSize=1)¶
__init__(canvas=None, sampleRate=1000.0, bufferSize=1)¶
Parameters:
  • canvas – canvas to plot on. Supply one if calling from GUI, if not a pyplot plot is created
  • sampleRate – Samples/sec to read from apd
  • timePerPt – time to average over these samples per plotted pt
__module__ = 'src.gui.PlotAPDCounts3'¶
dispImage()¶

Plots data using pyplot

dispImageGui()¶

Plots data to canvas, to be used with GUI

readAPD()¶

Reads from readthread defined above and averages over all samples taken in timeperpt :return: average value at timestep (scalar) to be plotted

startPlot(queue=None)¶

Once object created, call this function to start plotting :param queue: To stop plotting elegantly, pass in queue. Putting ‘STOP’ in queue breaks loop (other code can

execute in parallel because below code creates own thread)
src.gui.PlotAPDCounts3.counter_load_param(filename_or_json)¶

loads counter parameter from json file into gui
